alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:54AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Live Oak and western Bee Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 354 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Esseville, or near Campbellton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pawnee, Esseville, Whitsett and Nell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 71 and 83. US Highway 281 near mile marker 618. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
